title: Barbershop
occurrences: Well, it has been a whole two years since you took over the barbershop.
everything here but this barbershop.
you make sure that the sign outside always says "barbershop."
You're sure you're gonna keep the barbershop open, right?
I'm a businessman, and a barbershop ain't exactly a cash cow.
You told me that the sign outside would always say "barbershop."
It's gonna be called "The Barbershop." I'll keep that same theme going.
I sold the barbershop.
You sold your father's barbershop to Lester Wallace?
Let me tell you something. You will never own a black barbershop.
than black people, Isaac can own a black barbershop.
Barbershop.
Just hang out at the barbershop. You sure you can handle that?
But when you're at the barbershop, you keep your mouth shut.
Is this a barbershop? - Yes, it is.
I mean, if we can't talk straight in a barbershop...
There ain't nobody exempt in a barbershop! You know that.
You can talk about whoever and whatever, whenever you want to in a barbershop.
'Cause you don't belong here. The white barbershop is uptown.
This is the barbershop!
At the barbershop. - All day?
What you learn at the barbershop?
I'm gonna get my barbershop back.
You come in here demanding to get back a barbershop that you don't have anymore.
